Description: Lead cross pendant: cast as two separate pieces, the suspension loop is soldered to the cross, which has flared arms. The face of the A lead cross pendant cast as two separate pieces with a suspension loop soldered to a flared cross. The face of the cross is decorated with a continuous border enclosing roundels within each of the four arms of the cross and a central medallion at their intersection; the reverse is undecorated.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: John de Monins Johnson
Curator's comments: Cf., Stolz 2007, no. 123; Bénazeth 1992, E 15466 (p. 179). Bénazeth, D. 1992. Musée du Louvre: L’art du métal au début de l’ère chrétienne. Paris: Ministère de la culture, éditions de la réunion des musées nationaux. Stolz, Y. 2007. Byzantine jewellery and related small finds from the underwater excavations in the Bay of Abuqir in Egypt: Their typology, production and context. Unpublished PhD diss. Oxford University.
Bibliographic references: O'Connell et al 2014 / Antinoupolis at the British Museum (35)
